Inadequacy in regard to the above should be specifically pointed out in relation to each of the thermal power plant, more particularly in the State of Uttar Pradesh.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding environmental pollution caused by a school in Ashok Vihar, Delhi, 03/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change & Others
summary: NGT directs the school to obtain permission from the authority under Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules 2000, for using of loud speakers/ public address system in the school. Further, they are directed to seek prior permission from the authorities in respect of incidents or operation or for any function which may fall within the purview of Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules 2000.

subject: Sanitation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding disposal of municipal solid waste in the city of Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh, 03/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Environment Protection Act 1986, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981, Municipal Solid Waste (Management and Handling) Rules 2000.
summary: NGT directs Nagar Palika Parishad to start segregation, storage, treatment and disposal of MSW, on the site selected/ allotted for the purpose, in accordance with the Rules of 2016, within a period of four weeks. The Court also directed the District Administration and Pollution Control Board to ensure complete prohibition for use of carry bags and other plastic waste in the city of Vrindavan.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding environmental pollution caused by marriage halls located in Pune, Maharashtra, 03/07/2017
petitioner: Sujal Sahakari Gruha Rachana Sanstha Maryadit
act_referred: National Green Tribunal Act 2010, Environment (Protection) Act 1986, Development Control Rules 1987, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981
summary: NGT directs the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board to regulate the activities at marriage halls/ lawns as per the guidelines framed by them in performance of its functions under Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974 and Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981 within a period of next 2 months. In case of non-compliance, the Board shall take suitable legal action including that of closure of non-complying marriage halls/ lawns.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal sand mining along Neugal river, Palampur, Himachal Pradesh, 05/07/2017
summary: NGT directs the Applicant (Baljeet Singh) to pay Rs. 50,000/- as environment compensation. The amount shall be paid to Himachal Pradesh Pollution Control Board. The tipper of the applicant would be released, thereafter. The Learned Counsel appearing for the applicant makes a statement before us that besides paying compensation, they would give an undertaking to the effect, not to use the tipper for illegal and unauthorized mining and for transport purpose.

subject: Hazardous Waste
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding establishment of Bio-Medical Waste Treatment Facilities in Andhra Pradesh, 05/07/2017
summary: NGT disposes of the Application with a direction to the State Pollution Control Board to strictly follow its own guidelines and the guidelines framed by the Central Pollution Control Board in accordance with the Bio Medical Waste Management Rules, 2016 in respect of the installation and operation of the Common Bio Medical Waste Treatment Facilities in the State of Andhra Pradesh.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution of river Beas, Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, 06/07/2017
summary: The issue deals with municipal solid waste at Solan, Mandi, Himachal Pradesh as well as with regard to unauthorized constructions carried out within the High Flood Line on river Beas and other waterbodies.

subject: Dams/ Irrigation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding Kanhar Irrigation Project in District Sonebhadra, Uttar Pradesh, 06/07/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal directs the Project Proponent and the State of Uttar Pradesh to file complete and detailed affidavit in relation to compliance of the conditions imposed by the High Powered Expert Committee�s Report. Further, they should also clearly state in relation to each State (Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh), the status of the Resettlement and Rehabilitation (RR) Scheme and its implementation, the number of persons covered, cut-off date, the amount demanded and the amount paid. They shall also state in relation to catchment and command area falling within the canal scheme as well as dam.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding municipal solid waste disposal, Seelampur, Delhi, 06/07/2017
summary: NGT directs Show Cause Notices to be issued to the Commissioner of the East Delhi Municipal Corporation, P.W.D and NCT, Delhi, as to why appropriate orders be not issued by the Tribunal for violating its orders and polluting the environments.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding industrial pollution caused by Matharau Chemical Industries, Sangrur District, Punjab, 06/07/2017
act_referred: Air Act, Water Act,Environment Protection Act
summary: NGT dismisses the Application on the grounds that the Review Applicant (Gurcharan Singh Matharu) cannot disown his obligations by merely transferring his right in the unit, and the groundwater was continued to be polluted ever since the date of their industrial activities from 1991 onwards.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution caued by Saravana Fine Yarns, Dindigul District, Tamil Nadu, 06/07/2017
act_referred: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981
summary: NGT disposes of the Application because of lack of sufficient material produced by the Applicant farmers before the Loss of Ecology Authority and that there is no reason to hold that the Authority is wrong in having acted as per the scientific report of the Experts.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding construction in water bodies, Sangareddy District, Telangana, 07/07/2017
petitioner: Human Rights & Consumer Protection Cell Trust
summary: NGT directs the State of Telangana to ensure that the list of all the water bodies qualified to be brought under the Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules is finalised and appropriate action taken to preserve them by including them in the Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding encroachment and filling up of a waterbody Nayanjuli, South Dum Dum Municipality, Kolkata, West Bengal, 10/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Water (Prevention & Control of Pollution) Act 1974, Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules 2010
summary: NGT directs for the restoration of the fragmented water bodies of Nayanjuli between Golaghata and Sreebhumi and the water channel to be be cleared of all garbage, hydrophytes and sediments. The Judgement also stated that it is the responsibility South Dum Dum Municipality for the maintenance, preservation and regular cleaning of the entire stretch of the water body.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the issue of synthetic, glass coated and Chinese manjha for kite flying, 11/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Environment (Protection) Act 1986, Prevention of Cruelty of Animal Act 1960, Wildlife (Protection) Act 1972
summary: NGT directs a a total ban on the Manjha or thread for kite flying which is made of nylon or any synthetic material and/or is coated with synthetic substance and is non-biodegradable.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding Manoj Mishra's petitions in NGT adversely affecting the environmental religious rights, 11/07/2017
summary: The Applicant has alleged that Manoj Mishra and his fellow colleagues have filed several petitions in the guise of protection of environment and have adversely affected the environmental religious rights of the Hindu citizens by restraining them from immersing idols and other materials into the river Yamuna and declaring cracking of fire crackers and cremation of dead bodies by Hindus as polluting to the environment. NGT while dismissing the Application said that the perusal of the Application clearly states that it is a "sheer abuse of process of law".

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding municipal solid waste management in the State of Punjab, 11/07/2017
summary: NGT directs the Chief Secretary of the State of Punjab to hold a meeting attended by Secretary of Local Authorities, Secretary of Local Bodies, Secretary of Environment, Member Secretary of Pollution Control Board and the Commissioners of all the Corporations particularly Jalandhar, Bathinda and Firozpur. The project proponent shall also attend this meeting, through a representative, not less than Director Incharge/Managing Director. In the meeting all the eight clusters (for processing the municipal waste generated in the entire State) shall be the subject matter of thorough discussion.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution caused by Khatima Fibres Ltd., Uttarakhand, 11/07/2017
respondent: Uttarakhand Environment Protection and Pollution Control Board & Others
petition_result: Industry agrees to follow the pollution norms
summary: NGT directs that Khatima Fibres Ltd. shall bring its TSS (Total Suspended Solid) value as close as possible to 30 mg/l and would also ensure that their effluent from the outlet of the ETP is recycled to the extent it is possible but in any case not more than 25% of the effluent shall be discharged into the drain.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding thermal power plants located in the basin area of river Ganga discharging effluents into river Ganga, Uttar Pradesh, 12/07/2017
petitioner: Indian Council for Enviro- Legal Action (ICELA)
respondent: Ministry Of Environment And Forests (MOEF) & Others
summary: NGT directs MoEF and CPCB to conduct a joint inspection of the thermal power plant at Panki, Kanpur and submit a detailed report to the Tribunal.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding construction activities in the city of Shimla, Himachal Pradesh, 12/07/2017
summary: The Court expresses its displeasure at the delay of the Himachal Pradesh Government to file their response/objections to the report submitted before the Tribunal. NGT grants final opportunity to the State of Himachal Pradesh to submit its response/objections, if any, additional or otherwise.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding solid waste management of hotels and malls in Delhi, 12/07/2017
summary: The counsel appearing for the MoEF submits that he will seek instruction whether M/s. Lemon Tree Hotel has been inspected or not. No reply to the show cause notice has been filed. NGT grants last opportunity to file the reply.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding construction of a temple in a green area in Noida, Uttar Pradesh, 13/07/2017
summary: NGT dismisses the Application because the Applicant is not able to substantiate the allegations and also the nature of dispute is not within the scope of Section 14 of the National Green Tribunal Act, 2010.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding Ganga river pollution, 13/07/2017
judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore
act_referred: Environmental Protection Rules 1986, Hazardous Waste Management Rules 2016
summary: NGT notes that GAP I and GAP II has failed to yield the required results and on the contrary there has been tremendous increase in the industrial and sewage pollution load in river Ganga and its tributaries. That at Haridwar, Uttarakhand the natural flow of river Ganga is 31,000 cusecs, after which gets is reduced to 4000 cusecs when it reaches Kanpur and from certain STPs/CETPs, even the effluents directly enter river Ganga and its tributaries either because of overflow or the bypass created by such plants due to of low capacity of the plant.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the Environmental Clearance (EC) granted by the SEIAA for a housing project, Poisar Village, Mumbai, Maharashtra, 14/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Environmental Impact Assessment Notification 2006, Environmental Clearance Regulations 2006, Wildlife Conservation Act
summary: The project is a redevelopment project of a colony situated at Poisar Village, Mumbai. The impugned environmental clearance is for proposed expansion of the redevelopment project which was originally granted environmental clearance on 28th December, 2011. NGT disposed of the Application as it found no merit in the contentions raised challenging the EC.

subject: Fisheries
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding fishing with purse-seine gear/net and its adverse impact of marine biodiversity, 14/07/2017
petitioner: Sindhudurg Jilha Shramajivi Rapan Machhimar Sangh & Others
act_referred: Maharashtra Marine Fisheries Regulation Act 1981, Environment (Protection) Act 1986, Biological Diversity Act 2002
summary: NGT finds that the case deals with a substantial question relating to marine environment and arising out of implementation of the provisions of Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 and the Acts specified in Schedule-I of the NGT Act, 2010 thus arises in the present case due to inaction of the Central Government to discharge its obligations and take necessary steps for restitution of environment.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding mining in and around Parikrama Kshetra in District Bharatpur in Nagar and Pahadi Tehsil, Rajasthan, 14/07/2017
summary: NGT directs the chairman of the committee constituted by the Government of Rajasthan to visit the area and submit its report and recommendations with observations on the issues being highlighted by the Sadhu Samaj Samiti and also look into the grievances of the mining leaseholders who have been granted valid leases and environmental clearances. NGT's Order clearly states that a balance between both sides may be observed keeping in view the interest of the Sadhu Samaj Samiti which is advocating the interest of the pilgrims and yatris and also the mining lease owners. More importantly the forest department shall bring to the notice of the committee the steps which have been taken with regard to the restoration of the environment and forest in the areas where the mining operations had been ordered to be closed.

subject: Sanitation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding cleaning of drains in Delhi clogged with silt and municipal solid waste, Delhi, 17/07/2017
respondent: National Capital Territory of Delhi & Others
summary: NGT appoints counsels as Local Commissioners and directs them to visit the drains of North, South and East Delhi Municipal Corporations. Tribunal also directs that Trunk Drain No. 1 (passing through Seelampur) to be cleaned by the NCT Delhi, Department of Irrigation and Flood Control department within one week and ensure that there shall be no remnant of municipal solid waste and other waste and silt should be seen in the drain after the lapse of one week.

subject: Hazardous Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding bio-medical waste management of hospitals in Kolkata, West Bengal, 17/07/2017
respondent: West Bengal Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT grants the erring hospitals a final opportunity to comply with the pollution norms as recommended by the State PCB within three months. This shall include obtaining authorisations, consents to operate and completion of ETPS.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding damage to health caused by Associate Cement Company Ltd., Barmana, District Bilaspur, Himachal Pradesh, 18/07/2017
summary: Secretary, State of Himachal Pradesh submits that the Government has entered into a dialogue with the PGI, Public Health Department for conducting proper research to substantiate the damage caused by the cement plant.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding dumping of garbage on the river bed of River Yamuna by Mathura Cantonment Board, Uttar Pradesh, 18/07/2017
summary: NGT directs that the sum of Rs. 10 lakhs that the Cantonment Board is directed to pay to Central Pollution Control Board shall be paid to CPCB, however, the Cantonment Board will submit its proposal along with its payment, the manner in which they wish to develop the dumping site maintained by it.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding running of a ferro alloy manufacturing unit in village Lakhi Happa, Papumpare District, Arunachal Pradesh, 18/07/2017
summary: NGT directs the State PCB and the SEIAA, Arunachal Pradesh to inspect the units in question and verify as to whether the allegations contained in the Original Application are correct or not and file a report.

subject: Forests
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding running of a children's club in a reserve Langol Reserve Forest area, Manipur, 18/07/2017
summary: NGT notes that it is a clear contravention of the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980, making the concerned authorities of the Forest Department, Govt. of Manipur, liable for penalty as provided in Sec. 3 of the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980. NGT directs the State Respondents to file the Report of the DFO (Divisional Forest Office) as well as other documents.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding stone crushers operating unauthorisedly and illegally in the state of Uttar Pradesh, 19/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: It is laid before the Tribunal that the 21 offending stone crushers have been shut down and sealed by the administration. NGTdisposes of this Application with the directions that none of these sealed stone crushers would be permitted to operate unless they obtain consent from the State Pollution Control Board; proper no objection certificate from the concerned authorities and have the environmental clearance from the competent authority.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding a proposed dam on river Parwan affecting 1835 hectares forest land, Jhalawar District, Rajasthan, 19/07/2017
summary: The Tribunal expressed its satisfaction with the Wildlife, Environmental and Forest Clearance granted by MoEF as well as the various other clearances by the Ministry of Water Resources which the Court found to be in accordance with law. NGT directs the State Water Resources or any other department charged with the responsibility of the maintaining dam and flow of water in the river to ensure that downstream of the dam e-flow is maintained in Parwan river at all times so that there is no adverse impact on the aquatic life and also on the wild animals that may be traditionally using this river for drinking purposes.

subject: River Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding disposal of industrial waste into river Ganga by the leather industries of Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 20/07/2017
summary: NGT disposes of the Applications with the direction that a Joint inspection team shall inspect all the units even if they are not operational and submit a report before the Tribunal, which should be complete and comprehensive. It must be noticed whether the leather industries Primary Effluent Treatment Plant have been upgraded and there is a due system for discharge of Chromium.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding noise and dust pollution resulting from laying down of railway line by DMRC, 20/07/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for D.M.R.C. states that the premises in question, has already been vacated and it is ensured that the site will be properly restored, with at least 500 trees planted on 1.19 acres of land.

subject: Environment
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding degradation of environment at Rohtang Pass, Himachal Pradesh, 21/07/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal directed the Himachal Pradesh government to file an affidavit stating the number of taxis operating in Kulu and Manali under the different associations as well as a status report on the ropeway project on the Manali-Rohtang road. It also directed sarpanch of the Palchan panchayat, which had opposed the 9 km long Palchan-Rohtang ropeway, to appear before it on the next hearing.

subject: Water Resources
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding damage to Yamuna flood plains during the holding of the three day Art of Living event in Delhi, 21/07/2017
respondent: Art of Living International Center & Others
summary: NGT directs the Delhi Development Authority to nominate a very senior officer as a Member of the Committee which shall constitute of the Chief Engineer, Irrigation Department, NCT of Delhi and Chief Engineer, Irrigation Department, Uttar Pradesh. This Committee shall submit an Action Plan to the Tribunal with reference to the flood plains of river Yamuna where the event was held in March, 2016. This Committee shall prepare the action plan keeping in view the report of the Expert Committee appointed by the Tribunal within one week.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution caused by an industry in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh, 21/07/2017
summary: NGT takes notes of the two inspection reports of the joint inspection team which states that the industry has installed all the anti-pollution devices directed by the joint inspection team and as of present, if the devices operate properly, the industry is not likely to cause any pollution. Taking into consideration the Joint Inspection Report NGT allows the industry to carry on its manufacturing activity with immediate effect and the industry shall be liable to pay a sum of Rs. 15 lakhs as environmental compensation. NGT also directs that the industry shall within a period of three months install in an open area an RO Plant in discharge of its corporate social responsibility to ensure that the villagers around that area can get the water which is portable and can safely be consumed by the residents residing in that area.

subject: Environment
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding the proposed international airport at Mopa village in Goa, 21/07/2017
summary: Taking into consideration the Joint Inspection Report NGT allows the industry to carry on its manufacturing activity with immediate effect and the industry shall be liable to pay a sum of Rs. 15 lakhs as environmental compensation. NGT also directs that the industry shall within a period of three months install in an open area an RO Plant in discharge of its corporate social responsibility to ensure that the villagers around that area can get the water which is portable and can safely be consumed by the residents residing in that area.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding industrial units causing pollution, Ganesh Khariberia Village, Purba Khariberia, West Bengal, 21/07/2017
respondent: West Bengal Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT directs the State PCB to inspect the industrial units to verify on the allegations contained in the OA (Original Application) and file a report before the next date.

subject: Water Resources
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding the proposed construction of a centre of Aligarh Muslim University on the bank of river Mahananda in Kishanganj district, Bihar, 21/07/2017
act_referred: River Ganga (Rejuvenation, Protection and Management) Authorities Order 2016, Sustainable Sand Mining Management Guidelines 2016
summary: NGT directs notice to be issued to the Respondents.

subject: Environment
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding utilisation of the money deposited as penalty with the State Board, West Bengal, 21/07/2017
summary: The prayer is considered and allowed. However, the Court makes it clear that the exercise for working out action plan for the remaining districts shall also be prepared and filed before the court for similar direction.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding fly ash brick units operating without clearance Ganjam District, Odisha, 21/07/2017
summary: Counsel representing the fly ash brick units has sought permission to sell the existing stock of fly ash bricks produced by them prior to passing of the interim order dated 24.4.2017 undertaking that they shall not manufacture such bricks before obtaining NOC from the Central Ground Water Authority. NGT has agreed to the request.

subject: Agriculture
title: Order of the Supreme Court of India regarding farmers suicides in India, 27/03/2017
judge_name: D. Y. Chandrachud, Sanjay Kishan Kaul
summary: Supreme Court grants Central Government four weeks time to place before the Court the line of action which the Central Government proposes for adoption by the State Governments, for dealing with the serious consequences of farmer suicides.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the Supreme Court of India regarding functioning of PUC (Pollution Under Control) centres in Delhi NCR, 28/04/2017
summary: Some of the recommendations of the EPCA Report on the Assessment of Pollution under Control (PUC) Programme in Delhi and NCR submitted in the Supreme Court can be implemented by the Central Government in consultation with the Governments of Delhi, Rajasthan, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh according to the Solicitor General. Matter is adjourned to 26/07/2017 on which date the Solicitor General will inform the Court which are the recommendations that can be implemented without any difficulty.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court bans sale of BS-III vehicles from April 1, 2017
summary: The Supreme Court imposed a ban on sale of BS-III vehicles from April 1, 2017 when the Bharat Stage (BS)-IV emission norms for vehicles will come in force. The apex court also clarified that no new BS-III registration will be allowed April 1 onwards. However, BS-III vehicles sold prior to March 31 will be allowed to register and will need to have proof of sale date for those vehicles.

subject: Forests
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding encroachment of forest land, Dumka District, Jharkhand, 11/04/2017
summary: Tribunal grants the State of Jharkhand one last opportunity to file a detailed affidavit giving details of the areas encroached upon thus far, steps taken against the encroachers and the present status of the actions taken.

subject: Energy
title: Judgement of the Supreme Court of India regarding Adani Enterprises Consortium seeking a hike in power tariffs due to escalation in the price of coal, 11/04/2017
judge_name: Pinaki Chandra Ghose, R. F. Nariman
act_referred: Indian Electricity Act 1910, the Electricity (Supply) Act 1928, Electricity Regulatory Commissions Act 1998, Electricity Act 2003, Electricity (Supply) Act 1948
summary: An important part of the case is that a change in law in Indonesia took place in 2010 and 2011, which aligned the export price of coal from Indonesia to international market prices instead of the price that was prevalent for the last 40 years.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding cleaning and rejuvenation of river Ganga, 30/03/2017
judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore
summary: After the meeting (11/04/2017) day-to-day hearing of the case would start from 17th April, 2017 till concluded.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding groundwater extraction by Beltek Canadian Water Ltd., Noida, Uttar Pradesh, 28/04/2017
summary: NGT finds the inspection report of the unit incomplete as it does not fulfill the very purpose of the inspection which was to get direct material information on the extraction of ground water and quantity of water extracted.

subject: Forests
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding grant of forest clearance for the construction of Agra-Lucknow Expressway, 28/04/2017
summary: NGT directs the Project Proponent UPEIDA (UP Expressways Industrial Development Authority) and MoEF must file joint statement in a tabulated form, giving location of the alleged violation of the provisions of the Forest Act, number of trees felled, details of the cases registered, action taken, order if any, resulting in compounding of the offences and amount of fine imposed and recovered.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding solid waste management in the railway station of Howrah, West Bengal, 25/04/2017
summary: NGT directs the State PCB to inspect the Howrah Railway station and its yards and verify all the aspects raised by the applicant Subhas Datta and submit a report.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding municipal solid waste management in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, 24/04/2017
petitioner: Sangam Vihar Residents Welfare Association & Others
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: NGT directs the Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam to explore the possibility of out-sourcing the MSW composting to avoid further continuous degradation of the atmosphere and adverse impact on the environment besides the life the local residents.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal mining in Kaimur Wildlife Sanctuary, Sonebhadra District, Uttar Pradesh, 20/04/2017
summary: In response to an application under RTI Act, information has been given that there are 118 illegal mining operation in the area in question.

subject: Forests
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding encroachment of forest land, Dumka District, Jharkhand, 11/04/2017
summary: Tribunal grants the State of Jharkhand one last opportunity to file a detailed affidavit giving details of the areas encroached upon thus far, steps taken against the encroachers and the present status of the actions taken.

subject: Forests
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding felling of trees, Jaunapur and Dera Mandi, Delhi, 20/04/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: GT in the Order dated 11/12/2015 had directed NCT Delhi to take necessary measures to stop illegal activities of construction, laying of concrete RCC roads, both felling and cutting of trees, mining, digging of borewells, disposal of MSW and burning of plastic inside the forest area expeditiously which was not followed upon.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal mining in the state of Gujarat, 18/04/2017
respondent: Virender Singh (State of Gujarat) & various other Noticees
summary: NGT directs issuance of Notice to persons who have been found doing illegal mining and the State Government have imposed upon them a penalty of more than Rs. 50 lakh.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding mining lease over government and tenancy land, Jharkhand, 11/04/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Jharkhand Minor Mineral Concession Amendment Rules 2017
summary: NGT directs the State of Jharkhand not to give effect to the Jharkhand Minor Mineral Concession Amendment Rules, 2017 until it reaches its finality.

subject: Sanitation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding closure of slaughter house, Manglaur, Haridwar district, Uttarakhand, 11/04/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for Municipal Council of Manglaur submits that the slaughter house being run by the Council has already been shut. The Competent Authority has also granted approval for construction of new slaughter house outside the township.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding constructions inside Gulmohar Park, Delhi, 10/04/2017
summary: It has been submitted by the Counsel appearing for SDMC (South Delhi Municipal Corporation) that the alleged structure in the Municipal Park has been demolished and within a short span of time, remaining work regarding removal of debris would be done.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal mining at Kurghot and Shirdon, Sholapur, Maharashtra, 11/04/2017
summary: Additional Collector, Sholapur submitted before NGT that Shri Laxmi Enterprises and Yashwant Engineering have obtained Environmental Clearance from State Environment Impact Assessment Authority. However, they have not obtained consent of the Board for carrying on the mining activity. They also had no permission from the Collector for carrying on river mining activity by suction pump.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding consent to operate for Nusrat Tannery, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 25/07/2017
respondent: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board Pvt. Ltd.
summary: NGT disposes of this Application with the permission to the Applicant that if he has complied with all the conditions that have been imposed, the industry should approach Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board for issuance of consent to operate which should be complete, comprehensive and definite in all respects. If such application is moved, the unit shall be subjected to an inspection by the joint inspection team, report of which shall be submitted before the Tribunal.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding Consent to Operate for M/s Paramount Tanning Industries, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 25/07/2017
summary: The joint inspection team after inspection of the unit has submitted the report. In that report, it has been stated that the unit is compliant and non polluting and in fact, it has been recommended that the unit may be permitted to operate. In view of that report, the Court permits the industry to operate in accordance with law and subject to inspection on regular intervals.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding municipal solid waste management in public buildings and public spaces of Delhi, 25/07/2017
summary: All the Corporations, through their Commissioners, are directed to file affidavit stating as to how they propose to deal with the dumping sites under their jurisdiction and any proposed action for construction of waste to energy or any other plant to deal with the municipal solid waste in Delhi. All the Corporations are directed to give the exact quantum of waste being generated in Delhi.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding discharge of toxic waste by the factories at the Pharma City, Dehradun into River Yamuna, 25/07/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal directs the Uttarakhand Pollution Control Board to submit affidavit stating the time period from which the industries have been operating without consent of the Board. The Uttarakhand Pollution Control Board and the representative of the Central Pollution Control Board shall conduct a joint inspection of all these industries (14) and submit a complete and comprehensive report before the Tribunal within four weeks.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding steel pickling units in Delhi, 25/07/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: National Green Tribunal directs Delhi Pollution Control Committee to file affidavit as to why they have not complied with the order of the Tribunal and issued directions under the relevant provision of Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974 and Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981 for closure of these industries and consequent to it disconnection of electricity.

subject: Environment
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding Royal Calcutta Turf Club in Kolkata Maidan releasing effluents without treatment, Kolkata, West Bengal, 25/04/2017
summary: It is alleged by the applicant that considerable amount of effluents without treatment are being discharged and the veterinary hospital maintained by the club for treatment of the horses also releases biomedical wastes. Apart from this, issue of untreated disposal of wastes from the stable has also been raised by the applicant.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding unauthorized construction in Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh, 27/04/2017
petitioner: Society for Preservation of Kasauli and its Environs (SPOKE)
act_referred: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981
summary: According to two officers (Praveen Gupta and Anil Kumar) of the Himachal Pradesh State Pollution Control Board "there is no prescribed procedure in the Board for submission, processing and passing of the consent under the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974 and Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981 and any other matters falling in the jurisdiction of the Board.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding registration of BS-IV compliant diesel trucks, Delhi, 28/07/2017
judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore
summary: Application filed by the Delhi Cantonment Board is allowed by the Tribunal subject to the condition that the diesel trucks of Delhi Cantonment Board which are 10 years old will not be used any more and they will be auctioned for the purpose of dismantling and/or being plied in the area outside of Delhi which have been identified as the area where the ambient air quality is within the prescribed standards. The new trucks would be registered only after this and they shall be used by the Delhi Cantonment Board only for transportation of waste and will not be used for any private purpose.

subject: Pesticides & Toxins
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding insecticide manufacturers are circumventing the mandatory requirement of obtaining EC, 27/07/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal rules that the expression �pesticides� squarely takes within its ambit and scope the expression �insecticides� as well. Resultantly, all the manufacturers of insecticides and particularly the private respondents are liable to take prior EC in terms of the Notification of 2006. Court also direts MoEF&CC to issue a public notice and a general circular to all the Pollution Control Boards and other competent authorities informing them about this judgement of the Tribunal and providing a period of six weeks to the private respondents and all other manufacturers of insecticides to apply for obtaining the EC for manufacturing of such insecticides.

subject: Mining
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding shutting down of mining operations in mines where coal fires are currently burning, 24/07/2017
summary: NGT disposes off the Application on the ground that the Supreme Court has issued several directions from time to time and is still monitoring the issues, thus it is desirable to await further orders of the Supreme Court.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal mining and sinking of the area in and around Umaria, Madhya Pradesh, 21/07/2017
summary: NGT directs that the matter be taken up on an urgent basis so as to take necessary steps in accordance with the recommendations to prevent loss of any life and property. At the same time, the Court also directed that the Expert Appraisal Committee (EAC) to involve the State Government and / or District Administration along with South Eastern Coalfields (SECL) in this behalf.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the Supreme Court of India regarding air pollution by the bursting of firecrackers, 31/07/2017
summary: Supreme Court directs that no fire-crackers manufactured shall contain antimony, lithium, mercury, arsenic and lead in any form whatsoever and it is the responsibility of the Petroleum and Explosive Safety Organisation (PESO) to ensure compliance particularly in Sivakasi. Apex Court also makes it clear that for setting up of standards, collaborative efforts will be made between CPCB and PESO.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the Supreme Court of India regarding air pollution caused by bursting of fire crackers, 26/07/2017
summary: The Court noted that no standards have been laid down by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) with regard to air pollution caused by bursting of fire crackers and it is also not clear whether "Petroleum & Explosives Safety Organization (PESO) is capable of determining the extent of air pollution that could be caused by bursting of fire crackers". Counsel for the State of NCT of Delhi submitted before the Court that within three weeks a vigorous campaign will be started in the schools in Delhi to inform the children about the hazardous and ill-effects of the indiscriminate bursting of fire crackers.

subject: Mining
title: Judgement of the Supreme Court of India regarding illegal mining in Keonjhar, Sundargarh and other Districts of Odisha, 02/08/2017
act_referred:
Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation)
 Act 1957, Forest (Conservation) Act 1980, Environment (Protection) Act 1986, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981, Mineral Concession Rules 1960, Minerals (other than Atomic and Hydrocarbons Energy Minerals) Concession Rules 2016, Mineral Concessions Rules 1960
summary: Supreme Court directs the Union of India to have a "fresh look at the National Mineral Policy, 2008 which is almost a decade old, particularly with regard to conservation and mineral development. The exercise should be completed by 31st December, 2017". The Judgement also mentions that some of the mining lease holders had deposited an amount of Rs.237.05 crores for utilization by the SPV (Special Purpose Vehicle) for carrying out welfare works and activities in the districts of Keonjhar, Sundergarh and Mayurbhanj in Odisha.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the industrial unit of M/s Proctor and Gamble Home handling hazardous products without obtaining EC, Mandideep, Raisen District, Madhya Pradesh, 03/08/2017
summary: NGT in its Judgement states that the requirement of EC is not applicable in the case of M/s Proctor and Gamble Home unit in Mandideep. Court directs that precaution needs to be adopted by the unit in handling hazardous materials and it is duty bound that such labour which is engaged should be adequately explained the hazards if any that they may encounter while handling such material and further that the labour handling such material should watch out for and report any particular symptoms that would indicate any ill effects of handling of such materials.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding registration of diesel vehicles which are BS-IV compliant, Delhi NCR, 03/08/2017
summary: NGT allows the Application subject to the condition that Indian Oil Corporation has not got any diesel truck/vehicle which are more than 10 years old and the they are not plying any such vehicle carrying on for petroleum and other products in NCR Delhi.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding the municipal solid waste management plant of Bathinda, Punjab, 04/08/2017
summary: NGT in its Order said that as a result of non-functioning of the plant, it is the public health and environment at large, which is the victim. The plant at Bathinda was pilot project in the State of Punjab and on the basis of which remaining clusters; were to be constructed, but nothing has advanced, even this plant practically come to a halt causing serious public health and environmental degradation in the area of Bathinda.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding air pollution resulting from crop residue burning, 04/08/2017
summary: Court takes a stern view of the fact that in spite of the orders and judgement of the NGT the states (Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan) have failed to comply with the directions and take preventive precautionary and controlling measures for air pollution resulting from crop burning. NGT grants last and final opportunity for the states to file Action Plans with complete accountability and elements of performance, within one week.

subject: Forests
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding large scale illegal felling of trees near Tara Devi Temple, Shimla, Himachal Pradesh, 01/08/2017
summary: NGT states that both the seller and the purchaser are the beneficiary of the illegal and unauthorized felling of trees which has caused immense adverse impact on the environment and ecology of the area, thus it is of the view that both the seller and the purchaser are responsible for payment of environmental compensation in terms of Section 15 and 17 of the NGT Act, 2010.

subject: Forests
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding forest fires across the State of Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh, 03/08/2017
summary: NGT directs that the MoEF & CC in consultation with the States formulate National policy/Guidelines for forest fire prevention and control, which should be updated periodically. It should also issue directions under Section 5 of the Environment Protection Act, 1986 to the States to prepare and implement forest fire management plan for effective prevention and control of forest fires in the respective States. NGT also makes it clear that the first lot of such policy should be issued within 3 months from the date of passing of this judgment.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding rejuvenation of river Ganga, 08/08/2017
summary: NGT directs the stakeholders to file their status reports and the action plan in relation to prevention, control and rejuvenation of river Ganga. If the report is not filed, each State would be liable to pay cost of Rs. 50,000/- each and also their Member Secretaries will be present before the Tribunal.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding municipal solid waste management at Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, 09/08/2017
summary: The Deputy Commissioner, Mandi submits before the Tribunal that the matter in relation to municipal solid waste, landfill and plant at Mandi are being taken up by all concerned authorities with utmost seriousness and certain finances have also been received by him. NGT grants time by way of last opportunity.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding grant of consent to operate for M/s Avanti Metals Industries, Uttarakhand, 08/08/2017
respondent: Uttarakhand Environment Protection & Pollution Control Board
summary: NGT permits participation of the CGWA in this proceedings as it appears the location of the factory in question is in Ganga basin.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding change in the classification of the panchayat area from CRZ III to CRZ II, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, 01/08/2017
act_referred: CRZ Notification 2011, Coastal Zone Management Plan
summary: NGT in its Order said that the Kerala Coastal Zone Management Authority has to conduct public hearing on all districts before finalising the draft Coastal Zone Management Plan of Kerala and know the views of the Panchayat. In addition if it is a developed Panchayat then it has to be classified as CRZ-II developed area. At present all the Panchayat areas are classified as CRZ-III.

subject: Solid Waste
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding indiscriminate use and dumping of plastic waste, Delhi, 10/08/2017
summary: NGT Orders that there shall be complete prohibition on use of plastic carry bags, made of plastic less than 50 microns and are noncompostable in entire NCT Delhi, for any purpose whatsoever and the NCT Delhi, Delhi Pollution Control Committee and all public authorities/local bodies shall ensure that sale, storage and use of such plastic at the shops or otherwise is not permitted. Also if any person is found in possession or uses such plastic, shall be liable to pay Environmental compensation of Rs. 5000/- per default.

subject: Water Resources
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding environmental/ minimum flow of the rivers despite hydro projects, 09/08/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: Counsel appearing for Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change submits that the Ministry has already completed river basin study of 6 river basins i.e. Siang River Basin, Twang River Basin, Bichom River Basin, Subansiri River Basin, Dibang River Basin and Lohit River Basin and upon study the Ministry has recommended the minimum flow of the river to be 18% of the average of lean season flow of the river. However, in some of the cases, it has stated to be even 20%. NGT directs that all the rivers in the country shall maintain minimum 15 % to 20% of the average lean season flow of that river.

subject: Animal Care
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding use of mules in Vaishno Devi shrine, Jammu & Kashmir, 09/08/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the Shrine Board submits that authorities are making all efforts to comply with the directions of the Tribunal for opening of newly constructed pedestrian way for Ardh-kuwari. The Court directs that the pedestrian path should be opened for public by September 2017 and the State Government shall deploy appropriate force so that no inconvenience is caused to the pilgrims wanting to go by that path.

subject: Wildlife
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding wildlife casualties due to vehicular movement on the National Highway-37 passing through the Kaziranga National Park, 09/08/2017
summary: Additional Chief Secretary, Government of Assam submits that Wildlife Institute of India has made certain recommendations for improving the sensor barriers installed by the State of Assam. These will be followed and improvement thereto in consultation with the Wildlife Institute of India will be completed by 30th September, 2017 positively. Thereafter they would install more sensor barriers particularly in the areas which are known animal corridors. Court directs that the technological and operational aspects with regard to sensors should be brought to the notice of the Tribunal by filing affidavit and technical data.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Judgement of the Supreme Court of India regarding ban on sale of fireworks in Delhi NCR, 12/09/2017
summary: Supreme Court said that a graded regulation is necessary which would eventually result in a prohibition.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the Supreme Court of India regarding transit fee levied by states on forest products and minerals among others, 15/09/2017

subject: Forests
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal regarding cutting of 5000 trees without permission, Tehsil Sanganer, District Jaipur, Rajasthan, 11/09/2017
summary: NGT directs notice to be issued to the State of Rajasthan regarding cutting of trees without due permission. Also status-quo with regard to the remaining 8000 trees which are proposed to be cut as alleged shall be maintained in case no permission has been received.
